pkgJson.name: pubblz-brief-src
pkgJson.description: single page overview of pubblz and pub-server

files.text:
---- / ---- name: pubblz brief background-image: /images/IMG_0986.JPG class: xx-large white center shadow #

pubblz brief [wishlist](/wishlist) ---- #box-what-is-pubblz ---- # What is pubblz? **pubblz** is an editor for writing and publishing on the web. Text content lives in fragments of markdown. Designs live in npm packages, created by experts using HTML, CSS, javascript etc. Images live in dropbox or the like. By cleanly separating the source from the design, pubblz insulates content owners from the complexities of modern web standards. Preview a sample [presentation](http://jldec.github.io/roadmap/) or [documentation](http://jldec.github.io/pub-pkg-font-awesome/), or visit [github](https://github.com/jldec/pubblz-brief) to check out the source for this page.. ---- #box-pub-server ---- # pub-server [pub-server](https://github.com/jldec/pub-server) is the technology underlying pubblz. Components include - a static site generator - an editor - a web server **pub-server** runs on [node.js](http://nodejs.org/). The generator and editor run in the browser, enabling instant preview. [Markdown](https://guides.github.com/features/mastering-markdown/) content is stored in text files - ready for github. The architecture is database-free. All code is MIT licensed. See [doc](http://jldec.github.io/pub-doc) for more details. ---- #box-npm-packages ---- # Designs and Extensions **pub-server** leverages the [npm](https://www.npmjs.com/about) javascript module ecosystem. **Developers** and **designers** can draw from the awesome [selection](https://www.npmjs.com/#home-stats) of npm modules to create new layouts, generator plugins, server plugins, integrations, and browser scripts. They can then [publish](https://www.npmjs.com/search?q=pub-server) their packages via the npm registry, to distribute their designs and extensions to **pubblz** users. Examples: [*this design*](https://github.com/jldec/pub-theme-brief), [documentation design](https://github.com/jldec/pub-theme-doc), [slideshow design](https://github.com/jldec/pub-theme-shower-ribbon), [icon package](http://jldec.github.io/pub-pkg-font-awesome), [font package](http://jldec.github.io/pub-pkg-font-open-sans/readme), [github integration](https://github.com/jldec/pub-src-github), [google authentication](https://github.com/jldec/pub-pkg-google-oauth), [authorize.net payments](https://github.com/jldec/authorize-net-dpm). ---- #box-static-hosting ---- # Static Hosting Generating HTML at publishing time just makes sense! Static websites are simpler, more secure, more reliable, more scalable and lower cost than database-driven CMS hosting. Many static generated sites are now hosted on services like [GitHub pages](http://githubengineering.com/rearchitecting-github-pages/), [Amazon S3](http://aws.amazon.com/s3/), and [netlify](https://www.netlify.com/). Static hosting can be combined with CDN services like [Amazon CloudFront](http://aws.amazon.com/cloudfront/) or [CloudFlare](https://www.cloudflare.com/). Real-time interactions like authentication and payments can be routed to separate back-end services. ---- #box-jurgen-leschner ---- # Jürgen Leschner [github](https://github.com/jldec?tab=repositories) | [linkedin](https://www.linkedin.com/in/jldec) Active in web, javascript, database, and content management technologies since 1996. founder / co-founder - Pi with (acquired by EMC) - Collego (acquired by MRO) - Interactive Workplace (acquired by Siebel). Engineering at Microsoft, VMware, EMC, MRO, Siebel, Lotus. MIT - EECS, EAP - MBA ---- #box-haydn-labs ---- # Haydn Labs **Haydn Labs** incorporated in Delaware in January 2014. The company is located at [CIC](http://cic.us/) in Cambridge MA. Registered domain name **pubblz.com**, and **pubblz** trademark in 2015. ---- #box-end ---- # Thank You ![](/images/IMG_1273.jpg)

---- /extending-github-pages ----
name: Extending GitHub Pages
background-image: /images/crewshell.jpg
class: x-large white bg-darker center shadow

# Opportunities for GitHub Pages

---- ----

## Github Pages is awesome!
- Zero-config CDN hosting
- Great http performance, fast invalidation
- Compression, expiration, mime-types just work
- Minimal-config own CNAME
- Git publishing workflow
- Free!

---- ----

## With some limitations
- no HTTPS
- no form handling
- no private pages
- no repo authz
- Jekyll-only SSG
- no proxy routes
- no CMS / editor

---- ----

## Github Pages users today
- Have to be ok with git, command line, text editor
- Work on a machine running OSX/Linux/Windows
- Manage files in a file system
- Jeykyll users also have to be ok with Ruby

---- ----

## What is pub-server?
- Static Site Generator (like Jekyll)
- Database-free Markdown-driven CMS
- Browser-based editor
- 100% JavaScript
- Extensible via npm modules

---- ----

## Web publishing

> 200M users on Automattic + SquareSpace + Wix + Weebly

---- ----

## Mobile & Responsive & ES6
- Driving a sea-change in web publishing
- Favoring frameworks like React (and pub-server)
- Written in Javascript
- Entirely new ecosystem of tooling and components
- Designed to render BOTH in-browser and on-server
- Developers don't want to write templates and helpers twice

---- ----

## Front-end components  

This is a window of opportunity for GitHub
to offer Web developers better tools.

### Front-end component CDN hosting
- Record and publish download counts
- Performance and error logging
- Analytics for developers

### Front-end component registry
- npm for Web devs
- Searchable by downloads
- Search by browser/framework compatibility
---- ----

## GitHub Pages for documentation
- Combination gh-pages and wiki
- Source repo: https://github.com/Netflix/Hystrix.git
- Pages repo: https://github.com/Netflix/Hystrix.pages.git
- Auto-published just like gh-pages
- Also support CNAMEs
- or https://github/com/Netflix/Hystrix/pages/ (not sure about CNAME)
- Pub-server would enable custom themes and wysiwyg editing

---- /wishlist ----
name: Feature Wishlist for GitHub Pages
background-image: /images/IMG_1273.jpg
class: x-large white bg-darker center shadow

# Wishlist for GitHub Pages
[brief](/)


---- #box-0 ----

## Usability

_This section was added 2015-10-23._

Using a special `gh-pages` branch instead of a separate repo makes publishing  on GitHub Pages unnecessarily complicated.

> Why can't GitHub Pages work more like GitHub wikis?

Wikis have their own git repository at `<id>/<main-repo>.wiki.git` which you can clone and pull/commit/push on `master`. This wiki repository is open by default for other GitHub users to edit -- something you just can't do with your `gh-pages` branch.

GitHub Pages sites should behave the same way. Pages sites should have their own repo for the ouput HTML, with a URL in the same domain as the source repo.

Now you could start doing things like hosting a staging site visible only to collaborators, or previewing a new generated site on your desktop before publishing it _!smile-o_.

---- #box-1 ----

## 1. https
These days, because of attack vectors like [ssl-stripping](http://www.thoughtcrime.org/software/sslstrip/), I would argue that any site with a form should be running over https. It's not enough for _only_ the form pages or post-urls to be encrypted.  And with [SNI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Server_Name_Indication), hosting HTTPS endpoints has become relatively inexpensive.

---- #box-2 ----

## 2. generic form handlers
Casual users don't require complex back-end services to handle forms for things like surveys and contact requests. Translating each form submit into an email, or collecting form-field contents into a spreadsheet is sufficient.

More complex multi-step forms such as those required for payments require custom-configured services (see proxy routes below).

---- #box-3 ----

## 3. private pages
Marking pages or directory paths or an entire site as private would be a high-value, low-cost feature for GitHub Pages, and would serve many use-cases.

Design agencies could publish previews for their customers to try out, or companies could create internal sites on accessible only to their employees.

Simple access control lists in a text file coupled with oauth would be a good start.

---- #box-4 ----

## 4. granular authz
For users to manage website content using 3rd-party tools with sites on GitHub Pages, those tools need to be able to write back to a GitHub repo without asking the owner for blanket write access to all their repos. 'Nuf said :)

---- #box-5 ----

## 5. more site generators
Language frameworks like JavaScript and React are rapidly picking up momentum.  

Opening the door for alternative [site generators](https://github.com/jldec/pub-server) to be run automatically when new content arrives in a repo (just like Jekyll) is important to keep the service attractive for developers who build sites with the latest tools.

---- #box-6 ----

## 6. proxy routes
In the past, mobile browser users were unable to see or block the traffic between pages they visit and 3rd party tracking services (or services posing as something else, but collecting data nevertheless). This era is thankfully coming to end.

A better way for users to interact with websites they trust, is for *all* traffic to go back through the same HTTPS endpoint.

The role of a static hosting service in all this is to proxy those requests matching specific routes, and forward them to real-time services on the back-end.

---- #box-7 ----

## 7. online content editor

> This is the elephant in the room when it comes to static site generators and  GitHub Pages.

How to enable non-technical users to maintain content on an existing site? Until this gap is addressed, GitHub Pages will be limited to sites maintained exclusively by technical users.

The solution suggested by the little [`Edit`](/pub/?page=%2F) button at the top-right is a start in this direction.

pub-server includes an editor+generator which can run in users' browsers, allowing instant preview without round-trips to a server.

For more information visit the pub-server repo on [github](https://github.com/jldec/pub-server).

---- #box-end ----

# Thank You.

---- /photo ----
name: pubblz Photo
background-image: /images/IMG_1273.jpg
class: x-large white bg-darker center shadow

# pubblz Photo

---- #box-pubblz ----

# pubblz

Enable people to **communicate** by publishing on the **web**

Using **designs** crafted in **HTML** by designers and developers and accessed by readers using a **browser**

Replacing **documents** shared via email

with **responsive** fresh experiences across modern devices


---- #box-photo ----

# pubblz Photo

Enable conumsers to publish photo-stories on the web

Using dropbox as the primary storage

And **designs** crafted in **HTML** by designers



---- #box-plans ----

# Plans

All plans require a dropbox account.

**Free plan**  
Also requires a GitHub account. Includes hosting, and custom domain.

**Basic plan** ($4.99/mo)  
No GitHub account needed. Uses S3 with CloudFlare or Cloudfront CDN. Includes HTTPS and private sharing.

**Professional plan** ($25/mo)  
Designed for businesses. Offers team editing, and support.

**A-la-carte services**  
payment processing, video streaming, support.


---- #box-github ----

# GitHub

> GitHub Pages is home to about three-quarters of a million sites, serves about a quarter of a million requests each minute, and completes about 20,000 builds each day. [ben balter](http://ben.balter.com/2015/06/11/using-github-pages-to-showcase-your-orgs-open-source-efforts/)


---- #box-customers ----

# Customers and Partners

### consumers
Publish single photos, videos, live-streams (meerkat), albums, shortform and longform posts.

### businesses
Publish announcements, press releases, blog posts, testimonials

### designer partners
Quality of design will be critical


---- #box-competitors ----

# Competitors

- facebook
- Medium
- tumblr
- smugmug
- instagram
- flickr
- Wordpress
- SquareSpace
- wix



---- #box-editor-app ----

# pubblz apps
Potential source of additional revenues.

### pubblz editor app
Improves stickyness

### pubblz designer tools
Plugin for [Atom](https://atom.io/) (GitHub editor)

---- #box-todo ----

# MVP - what's missing?

### developer product
- available today
- requires command line and other technical skills
- in production use at [www.fmctraining.com](https://www.fmctraining.com)

### consumer product
- [Medium-style](https://github.com/yabwe/medium-editor) wysiwyg editor
- [dropbox](https://www.dropbox.com/developers) integration
- image asset pipeline - basic resize

### operations
- signup, [identity]() service, with payments
- automated setup with CDN
- devops, monitoring
- documentation & support


---- #box-end ----

# Thank You.
![](/images/run2.jpg)

---- /canvas ----
name: pubblz canvas
background-image: /images/IMG_9898.jpg
class: x-large bg-darker white shadow

# pubblz Business Model Canvas


---- #box-value-proposition ----

# pubblz Value Proposition

Enable people to **communicate** by publishing on the **web**

Using **designs** crafted in **HTML** by designers and developers and accessed by readers using a **browser**

Replacing **documents** shared via email

With **responsive** fresh experiences across modern devices


---- #box-customer-segments ----

# Customers

### consumers
Publish photos, videos, live-streams, announcements, events, albums, shortform and longform posts, school projects, games ...

### business people
Publish presentations, websites, reports, project pages, team pages, analysis.

### designers
Can use pub-server as a tool to rapidly create HTML and CSS layouts, *not* necessarily just for other pub-server users.

### developers
Publish documentation, design docs, ideas, gists. Later also as a development environment.


---- #box-key-partners ----

# Partners

### designers
Quality of the HTML output designs will be critical for the perceived value of the service. Pubblz will need to showcase and reward designers.

Once a critical mass of users is achieved, pubblz can offer a **design marketplace** for top-tier designers to sell their work and support their users.

### developers
Open Source Software developers are essential for the evolution of the platform and its capabilities. Pubblz already uses some fantastic libraries internally. Real **magic** is possible when developers start writing plugins.

### service-partners and suppliers
Pubblz has been designed to leverage infrastructure as a service from providers like **Amazon** and **Cloudflare**, and will integrate with best-of-breed 3rd party services like **Stripe** for payments.


---- #box-competitors ----

# Competitors

### [Squarespace](http://squarespace.com/), [Wix](http://www.wix.com/), [Weebly](http://www.weebly.com/), [Shopify](http://www.shopify.com/), [Jimdo](http://www.jimdo.com/)
SaaS self-service website builders. Offer wysiwyg editing with professionally designed templates. Rapidly taking over lower-end web design and hosting business from agencies and even Wordpress. Profitable and spending heavily on marketing.

**Limitations:** Proprietary, integrated CMS, limited extensibility, no self hosting

### [Wordpress](https://wordpress.com/)
Wordpress is the dominant open source tool for website creation. Originally designed for blogging. Significant ecosystem of [themes](https://wordpress.org/themes/) and [plugins](https://wordpress.org/plugins/) and hosting [providers](http://wpengine.com/plans/).

Dated architecture based on PHP and mySQL. Vulnerable to security breaches because of integrated admin/CMS.

### [Google Docs]()
Google Docs was the first to offer real-time co-editing features. Originally modeled after Microsoft Office with similar content types, import/export features, and print capabilities - now also supports forms, add-ons. Google docs is popular with [schools](https://www.google.com/intl/en/edu/).

### Others
[Drupal](https://www.drupal.org/try-drupal), [Medium](https://medium.com/), [Ghost](https://ghost.org/), [slides.com](http://slides.com/),  [cloudcannon](http://docs.cloudcannon.com/overview/tour/)


---- #box-customer-relationships ----

# Channel: pubblz.com

**pubblz.com** will be the primary revenue channel. Customers signup online and pay with credit card. There will be a free trial period and referral discounts.

The **Basic plan** (not free) includes hosting, custom domain name and private sharing of content.

The **Professional plan** includes https, multi-user editing, and forms.

**A-la-carte services** payment processing, and support.

### free tier
Pubblz is free for developers to self-host e.g. on GitHub, Heroku or AWS.

A **consumer-free** offering would definitely help to promote the service and accelerate adoption, but also changes the "dynamics" of the business.

This may make sense in partnership with hosting providers, or in the context of an acquisition.

### Editor app
App-store sales of an editor could provide an additional source of non-recurring revenues, or serve to attract more subscribers. Certain editor features also work better in an app.


---- #box-todo ----

# MVP - what's missing?

### developer product
- available today
- requires command line, javascript, HTML, CSS and other technical skills
- in production use at [www.fmctraining.com](https://www.fmctraining.com)

### designer product
- missing CSS and HTML editor, single-click installer
- investigating plugin for [Atom](https://atom.io/) (GitHub editor)

### consumer product
- missing consumer-grade UX
- [Medium-style](https://github.com/yabwe/medium-editor) wysiwyg editor
- [dropbox](https://www.dropbox.com/developers) integration
- image asset pipeline - basic resize

### awareness
- missing early adopter marketing
- developers and designers

### operations
- signup, [identity]() service
- automated setup with CDN
- devops, monitoring
- documentation & support

---- #box-end ----

# Thank You.
![](/images/IMG_1358.JPG)
